# system

**Type Property**

The time zone currently used by the system.

## Declaration

```swift
class var system: TimeZone { get }
```

## Discussion

If the current system time zone cannot be determined, the GMT time zone is used instead.

If you access the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSTimeZone/system] class property, its value is cached by the app and doesn’t update if the user subsequently changes the system time zone. In order for the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSTimeZone/system] property to reflect the new time zone, you must first call the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSTimeZone/resetSystemTimeZone()] method to clear the cached value. Then, the next time you access the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSTimeZone/system] property, it returns the current system time zone, and caches that value.

If you access the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSTimeZone/system] class property, assign its value to a variable, and clear the cached value for the property by calling the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSTimeZone/resetSystemTimeZone()] method, the object stored in the variable doesn’t update to reflect the new system time zone. Contrast this behavior with that of the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSTimeZone/local] class property, which returns a proxy object that always reflects the current system time zone.

## Working with System Time Zones

- **local**: An object that tracks the current system time zone.
- **resetSystemTimeZone()**: Clears any time zone value cached for the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSTimeZone/system] property.
- **default**: The default time zone for the current app.
